notes: Compact SUV (1985-1995 in US). Known for rollover controversy. Lightweight off-roader. Discontinued in US after 1995. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Samurai article, January 2025 revision.
First and second generation compact SUV (1988-1998). Rebadged as Geo/Chevy Tracker. 4-door introduced 1991. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Sidekick article, January 2025 revision.
Unique 2-seat coupe SUV (1995-1997). Based on Sidekick. T-top removable panels. Commercial failure. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki X-90 article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation compact SUV (1998-2005). Renamed from Sidekick. Rebadged as Chevy Tracker. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Vitara article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation subcompact (1995-2001 in US). Rebadged as Geo/Chevy Metro. Economy car. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Swift article, January 2025 revision.
Compact sedan/wagon (1995-2002). Based on Suzuki Cultus Crescent. Budget-friendly. Data sourced from Wikipedia Suzuki Esteem article, January 2025 revision.
